intro: Cyanea holophylla var. obovata, commonly known as the Obovate Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has obovate leaves, which are broad and rounded at the ends, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
